title: The Papers: Minister sacked in 'sleaze row’ and ‘jab crisis’
description: The firing of a cabinet minister and the ongoing energy crisis lead several of Saturday's papers.

title: Lauren Parker beats Edna Malto to claim IBO intercontinental super-flyweight title
description: England's Lauren Parker puts in a battling performance to beat Mexico's Edna Malto to claim the IBO intercontinental super-flyweight belt.

title: SNP conference: Sturgeon will seek to exploit Truss's faltering start as PM
description: The SNP conference will hear much about the fallout from the UK government's tax cutting mini-budget.

title: Premiership: Bristol Bears 14-50 Exeter Chiefs - Visitors go top with seven-try haul
description: Jack Nowell and Olly Woodburn score two tries apiece as Exeter thrash Bristol in their Premiership match at Ashton Gate.

title: Eurovision 2023: Liverpool beats Glasgow to be song contest host city
description: Glasgow loses out as the UK prepares to stage the song contest next May on behalf of Ukraine.

title: England 2-1 USA: Lionesses beat world champions in Wembley friendly
description: England beat world champions the United States for the first time since 2017 before more than 76,000 fans in their first meeting at Wembley Stadium.

title: England 50-0 Fiji: Dominic Young stars on debut in Rugby League World Cup warm-up
description: Dominic Young stars on debut as England thrash Fiji 50-0 in their final warm-up game before hosting the Rugby League World Cup.

title: Eurovision in Liverpool will come at a significant cost
description: Now we know Liverpool will host Eurovision in 2023, questions are likely to move to funding the event.

title: Ellerby: Gold coins found hidden under kitchen floor sell for £754,000
description: The coins, found during kitchen renovations in East Yorkshire, have attracted global interest.

title: New York City declares state of emergency over migrant 'crisis situation'
description: Mayor Eric Adams said the city is on track to spend $1bn this fiscal year to care for asylum seekers.

title: Why Russia but not China faces human rights action
description: The UN has examined allegations of repression and human rights violations in both countries.

title: Stephen Lawrence case: Jamie Acourt to be freed in November
description: Jamie Acourt's sentence will be reactivated unless he starts paying back £90K he made in a drugs deal.

title: Creeslough: Multiple people injured in Donegal explosion
description: A hospital has moved to "major emergency standby" after the incident in a petrol station.

title: Ukraine war: Vladimir Putin gets a tractor for his 70th birthday
description: Gifts for Russia's embattled president include a tractor from Belarusian ally Alexander Lukashenko.

title: Ukraine war: World must act now to stop Russia, says Zelensky
description: In a BBC interview, Ukraine's president says urgent action is needed amid Russian nuclear threats.

title: Police officers face probe over 'grossly offensive' WhatsApp messages
description: A criminal investigation is launched into messages allegedly shared by police officers on WhatsApp.

title: Ed Sheeran is spotted playing in Ipswich
description: Crowds gather to watch the star as he performs his hit song The A Team.

title: Climate change: World aviation agrees 'aspirational' net zero plan
description: UN member states pledge to decarbonise air travel, but green groups say the deal is weak and non-binding.

title: Trade minister Conor Burns sacked from government
description: Trade minister Conor Burns dismissed from government after a complaint of serious misconduct, No 10 says

title: Post Office scandal: 'Why am I still fighting to clear my name?'
description: Rab Thomson is among 700 people who may have been wrongly convicted in the Post Office scandal.

title: Queen's profile created by pilot's 250-mile tribute flight
description: Amal Larhlid flew a Piper PA-28 for two hours as it was tracked by air traffic technology.

title: Man armed with knife shot dead by police in Derby
description: Armed officers shot the man in the secure car park of a police station in Derby.

title: Alejandro Valverde and Vincenzo Nibali prepare for last race
description: Il Lombardia monument marks the end of the careers of two of cycling's legends, Alejandro Valverde and Vincenzo Nibali.

title: DCI Banks author Peter Robinson dies aged 72
description: The writer, who was born and raised in Leeds, died after a short illness, his publisher announces.

title: Nicola Sturgeon says lack of contact from Liz Truss 'absurd'
description: The SNP leader says she has still not had a phone call from Liz Truss a month after she became PM.

title: Belarus, Ukraine, Russia activists win Nobel Peace Prize
description: The peace prize goes to Ales Bialiatsky, Russia's Memorial and the Ukrainian Center for Civil Liberties.

title: Moors Murders: Search for Keith Bennett ends with no evidence found
description: Police end a search for Keith Bennett's body after finding no sign of human remains at the scene.

title: Nobel Peace Prize: Moment NGO told on the phone it has won award
description: Oleksandra Romantsova, from the Center for Civil Liberties, responds emotionally upon learning of the award.

title: Rugby World Cup: Why England are favourites to win
description: Professionalism, respect and a very good maul - BBC Sport explores the reasons behind England's dominance.

title: Conor Benn is 'clean' despite failed drug test, says dad Nigel
description: Nigel Benn says his son Conor is "clean" despite a failed drug test leading to the postponement of his fight with Chris Eubank Jr.

title: Heysham explosion: Dad's anguish as boy killed by 'selfish' drunk
description: Two-year-old George Hinds died after drunken neighbour Darren Greenham cut a gas pipe for scrap.

title: Public won't be told to cut energy use after PM objects
description: A minister denies a full plan was blocked by Liz Truss's office and insists energy supplies are secure.

title: Covid: Protect elderly from rising virus levels in UK
description: With cases on the up, people who feel unwell are advised to avoid vulnerable relatives as a precaution.

title: Marshmallow ruling helps Loughborough firm in VAT fight
description: A company successfully argues its extra large mallows are a baking ingredient rather than a snack.

title: Complutense University: Spain investigates student 'whores' chants at women
description: Videos have circulated for days of male students chanting obscene misogynistic abuse in Madrid.

title: Watch: Jess Fishlock’s Wales winner against Bosnia-Herzegovina
description: Jess Fishlock's stunning extra-time volley secures a 1-0 win against Bosnia-Herzegovina and sends Wales into the World Cup play-off final.

title: Will Newcastle turn the 'big six' into 'big seven'?
description: One year on from Newcastle's controversial takeover, will they really gatecrash the Premier League's elite - and how noisy will the Saudi Arabian links become?

title: Eurovision 2023: Glasgow and Liverpool await decision on UK host city
description: Glasgow and Liverpool will find out on Friday which will stage the Eurovision Song Contest next May.

title: Record excess deaths in UK's heatwave summer
description: With record-breaking temperatures, there were around 3,000 more deaths than usual in England and Wales.

title: Steve Cooper: Nottingham Forest manager signs new deal until 2025
description: Nottingham Forest manager Steve Cooper signs a new contract with the club until 2025.

title: Daughter's plea over vulval cancer checks
description: Laura Christie hopes to raise awareness of vulval cancer, which claimed the life of her mother.

title: Iran protests: Nika Shakarami's mother says her daughter was murdered
description: Officials are lying about how 16-year-old protester Nika Shakarami died, her mother says.

title: Alexei Navalny: Russia's jailed vociferous Putin critic
description: Russian anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny has built up huge support on social media.

title: Kevin Spacey faces New York jury in sexual assault court case
description: The House of Cards stars is accused of a sexual assault in 1986, which he denies.

title: Blind Scottish pianist reaches BBC Young Musician final
description: Falkirk pianist Ethan Loch has been playing the piano since he was four years old.

title: Rare woodpecker returns to Dorset 'due to organic farming'
description: The Dorset Wildlife Trust spied the lesser spotted woodpecker at Hollis Mead farm in Corscombe.

title: Nobel Peace Prize: Who is Ales Bialiatski?
description: A profile of a Belarusian human rights activist, one of three winners of the prestigious award in 2022.

title: Nicola Sturgeon issues warning over winter energy usage
description: The FM has said people should be "sensible" after the National Grid warned of possible blackouts.

title: Molly Russell father: Social media culture must change
description: The teenager's father Ian spoke to the BBC about what he wants families to learn from his daughter's story.

title: WWE: Sara Lee, Tough Enough star, dies aged 30
description: Tributes pour in for Sara Lee, the winner of the wrestling giant's 2015 Tough Enough reality series.

title: Train strikes: Passengers told to avoid travel on Saturday
description: The latest strike means only one in five trains will run, with services starting late and finishing early.

title: Mortgage rate rises set to put pressure on house prices, says Halifax
description: The Halifax says higher mortgage costs could put "significant downward pressure" on the market.

title: Gateshead stabbing: Boy charged with Tomasz Oleszak murder
description: The teenager is due in court later charged with the murder of Tomasz Oleszak, 14, in Gateshead.

title: Japanese Grand Prix: George Russell leads Mercedes one-two in wet practice
description: George Russell heads Lewis Hamilton to a Mercedes one-two on a wet Friday practice at the Japanese Grand Prix.

title: England: The strikers looking to challenge Harry Kane at the World Cup in Qatar
description: Gareth Southgate will soon be naming his World Cup squad and BBC Sport has run the rule over his attacking options behind Harry Kane.

title: Avanti West Coast told to drastically improve rail services
description: The train operator is given a short-term extension to continue running services on the west coast mainline.

title: Molly Russell inquest: Family 'numb' about inquest verdict
description: The father of Molly Russell says his family is "still processing" the verdict into her death.

title: Vicky McClure's dementia choir releases debut single
description: The aim of the single is to show that patients "are more than their diagnosis".

title: Rugby World Cup: Women’s rugby to reach new heights as ‘golden era of opportunity’ beckons
description: The Rugby World Cup begins in New Zealand on Saturday and BBC Sport explores why it is the biggest women's edition yet.

title: Conor Benn v Chris Eubank Jr: Common sense prevails on 'grim day for boxing'
description: BBC Sport reflects on a "grim day for boxing' after the cancellation of Conor Benn v Chris Eubank Jr and where Benn goes from here after being thrust into the centre of a doping scandal.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Ellie Simmonds' 'heart touched' by support
description: Ellie Simmonds says she is not only on a Strictly journey with her partner but the dwarfism community.

title: Thailand attack: Country mourns after 37 killed, mostly children
description: An ex-police officer killed at least 37 people at a childcare centre before killing himself and his family.

title: Easter Island: Sacred statues damaged by fire
description: Many of the enigmatic stone-carved statues are "totally charred" according to local authorities.

title: Social care: 'Jo's care will cost £1.5k a week - the system is broken'
description: A BBC poll reveals people's worries about social care. So what is the new government going to do?

title: Ukraine war: Biden says nuclear risk highest since 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis
description: Joe Biden says President Putin was "not joking" when he spoke of using tactical nuclear weapons.

title: Adidas puts Kanye West Yeezy deal under review
description: Earlier this week, the rapper and fashion designer wore a t-shirt that read "White Lives Matter".

title: The Bradford wrestling church mixing sermons with suplexes
description: Baptisms and body slams are all part of a day's work for one church which aims to help young people.

title: Big Butterfly Count: Sightings worryingly low, say UK conservationists
description: Conservationists say they expected this year's warm summer to be a much better one for butterflies.

title: Dancers' moves help to power Glasgow music venue
description: Heat energy is being captured from people dancing to help a Glasgow venue reduce its carbon emissions.

title: UK defies climate warnings with new oil and gas licences
description: More than 100 licences are expected to be granted for new fossil fuel exploration in the North Sea.
